  • Constructor Details

    • RsInstrument

      public RsInstrument​(String resourceName, boolean idQuery, boolean resetDevice, String optionString) throws RsInstrException
      Driver constructor with all parameters.
      Parameters:
      resourceName - VISA resource to open the instrument
      idQuery - Check the identification query and throw an exception if the RsInstrument does support the instrument
      resetDevice - Performs an instrument reset
      optionString - comma-separated tokens:
      • 'Simulate = true' - starts the session in simulation mode. Default: false
      • 'SelectVisa = VisaC | VisaC-Rs | VisaC-Ni | SocketIo' - selects VisaC implementation (OS-standard, R&S VISA or NI VISA), or SocketIo (no Visa). implementation. Default: 'VisaC'
      • 'QueryInstrumentStatus = false' - same as driver.instrumentStatusChecking = false. Default: true
      • 'WriteDelay = 20, ReadDelay = 5' - Introduces delay of 20 ms before each write and 5 ms before each read. Default: 0 ms for both
      • 'OpcWaitMode = OpcQuery' - mode for all the opc-synchronised write/reads. Other modes: ServiceRequest, StbPolling, StbPollingSlow, StbPollingSuperSlow. Default: StbPolling
      • 'TermChar = '\n'' - Termination character for read and write. Default: '\n'
      • 'AddTermCharToWriteBinData = true' - Adds one additional TermChar to the end of the binary data (some instruments require that). Default: false
      • 'AssureWriteWithTc = true' - Makes sure each command/query is terminated with the TermChar. Default: Interface dependent
      • 'IoSegmentSize = 10E3' - Maximum size of one write/read segment. If transferred data is bigger, it is split to more segments. Default: 1E6 bytes
      • 'OpcTimeout = 10000' - same as driver.setOpcTimeout(10000). Default: 30000 ms
      • 'VisaTimeout = 5000' - same as driver.setVisaTimeout(5000). Default: 10000 ms
      • 'OpcQueryAfterWrite = true' - same as driver.setOpcQueryAfterEachSetting(true). Default: false
      • 'VxiCapable = false' - you can force a session to a VXI-incapable. Default: Interface dependent
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • RsInstrument

      public RsInstrument​(String resourceName, boolean idQuery, boolean resetDevice) throws RsInstrException
      Opens new instrument with the given resource name. You can check the IDN string and reset the instrument.
      Parameters:
      resourceName - VISA resource to open the instrument
      idQuery - Check the identification query and throw an exception if the RsInstrument does support the instrument
      resetDevice - Performs an instrument reset
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • RsInstrument

      public RsInstrument​(String resourceName) throws RsInstrException
      Opens new instrument with the given resource name. No other actions or checks take place
      Parameters:
      resourceName - VISA resource to open the instrument
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

  • Method Details

    • hasValidSession

      public boolean hasValidSession()
      Returns true, if the session is still active and valid.

    • close

      public void close() throws VisaException
      Throws:
      VisaException

    • listResources

      public static String[] listResources​(String expression, boolean vxi11, boolean lxi, String visaPlugin) throws VisaException
      Finds all the resources defined by the expression - '?*' - matches all the available instruments - 'USB::?*' - matches all the USB instruments - "TCPIP::192?*' - matches all the LAN instruments with the IP address starting with 192
      Parameters:
      expression - see the examples in the function
      vxi11 - use the VXI-11 mechanisms (only supported by R&S VISA)
      lxi - use the mDns mechanisms (only supported by R&S VISA)
      visaPlugin - to use for instruments search.Supported plugins:
      • VisaC
      • VisaC-RsVisa
      • VisaC-NiVisa
      Throws:
      VisaException

    • listResources

      public static String[] listResources​(String expression, boolean vxi11, boolean lxi) throws VisaException
      Finds all the resources defined by the expression using 'VisaC' plugin - '?*' - matches all the available instruments - 'USB::?*' - matches all the USB instruments - "TCPIP::192?*' - matches all the LAN instruments with the IP address starting with 192
      Parameters:
      expression - see the examples in the function
      vxi11 - use the VXI-11 mechanisms (only supported by R&S VISA)
      lxi - use the mDns mechanisms (only supported by R&S VISA)
      Throws:
      VisaException

    • listResources

      public static String[] listResources​(String expression) throws VisaException
      Finds all the resources defined by the expression using 'VisaC' plugin. No VXI-11 or LXI search mechanism. - '?*' - matches all the available instruments - 'USB::?*' - matches all the USB instruments - "TCPIP::192?*' - matches all the LAN instruments with the IP address starting with 192
      Parameters:
      expression - see the examples in the function
      Throws:
      VisaException

    • queryOpc

      public boolean queryOpc​(Integer visaTimeoutMs) throws RsInstrException
      Sends *OPC? query and reads the result. By the nature of the command, it also waits for all the running operations to finish. The VISA timeout is defined only for this call. Null means - use the current visaTimeout
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryOpc

      public boolean queryOpc() throws RsInstrException
      Sends *OPC? query and reads the result. By the nature of the command, it also waits for all the running operations to finish.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • getInstrumentStatusChecking

      public boolean getInstrumentStatusChecking()
      Gets Instrument Status Checking. When true (default is true), all the driver methods and properties are sending "SYST:ERR?" at the end to immediately react on error that might have occurred. We recommend keeping the state checking ON all the time. Switch it OFF only in rare cases when you require maximum speed.

    • setInstrumentStatusChecking

      public void setInstrumentStatusChecking​(boolean value)
      Sets Instrument Status Checking. When true (default is true), all the driver methods and properties are sending "SYST:ERR?" at the end to immediately react on error that might have occurred. We recommend keeping the state checking ON all the time. Switch it OFF only in rare cases when you require maximum speed.

    • getOpcQueryAfterEachSetting

      public boolean getOpcQueryAfterEachSetting()
      Gets Instrument *OPC? query sending after each setting. When true, (default is false) the driver sends *OPC? every time a write command is performed. For queries, the *OPC? is skipped. Use this if you want to make sure your sequence is performed command-after-command.

    • setOpcQueryAfterEachSetting

      public void setOpcQueryAfterEachSetting​(boolean value)
      Sets Instrument *OPC? query sending after each setting. When true, (default is false) the driver sends *OPC? every time a write command is performed. For queries, the *OPC? is skipped. Use this if you want to make sure your sequence is performed command-after-command.

      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • getLock

      public ReentrantLock getLock()
      Returns lock object used for locking the instrument communication sections. You can assign it to another object which communicates with the same physical instrument to make the communication multithreading-safe.

    • setLock

      public void setLock​(ReentrantLock lock)
      Sets lock object used for locking the instrument communication sections.

    • disableLock

      public void disableLock()
      Disables the locking of the instrument communication sections. From this moment on, the RsInstrument object is no more multithreading-safe.

    • selfTest

      public int selfTest() throws RsInstrException
      SCPI command: *TST? Performs instrument's selftest and returns null if the selftest passed
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • selfTest

      public int selfTest​(int selftestTimeout) throws RsInstrException

      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • clearStatus

      public void clearStatus() throws RsInstrException
      Clears instrument's status system, the session's I/O buffers and the instrument's error queue.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryErrorOldest

      public String queryErrorOldest() throws RsInstrException
      SCPI command: SYSTem:ERRor? Queries and deletes the oldest error in the instrument's error queue. Returns the oldest error that occurred. If no error is present, the method returns {code=0, msg='No Error'}
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryErrorsAll

      public String[] queryErrorsAll() throws RsInstrException
      SCPI command: SYSTem:ERRor? Queries and clears the errors from the instrument's error queue. The errors are ordered from the oldest ones to the newest one. The method calls the 'SYSTem:ERRor?' in a loop until the error queue is empty.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • CheckStatus

      public void CheckStatus() throws RsInstrException
      Throws InstrumentStatusException in case of an error in the instrument's error queue.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • reset

      public void reset() throws RsInstrException
      SCPI command: *RST Sends *RST command + calls the ClearStatus()
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • processAllPreviousCommands

      public void processAllPreviousCommands() throws RsInstrException
      SCPI Command: *WAI Stops further commands processing until all commands sent before *WAI have been executed.

      RsInstrException

    • queryString

      public String queryString​(String query) throws RsInstrException

    • queryStringWithOpc

      public String queryStringWithOpc​(String query, Integer timeoutMs) throws RsInstrException
      Sends the opc-synced query to the instrument and returns the response as string. The response is trimmed of any trailing TermChars and has no length limit. If timeoutMs is null, -1 or 0, the current Opc Timeout is used.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryStringArray

      public String[] queryStringArray​(String query) throws RsInstrException
      Sends the query to the instrument and returns the response as string list of unlimited length. Each element is trimmed for paired quotes and trailing spaces. If the response is empty, the method returns 0-length List.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryStringArrayWithOpc

      public String[] queryStringArrayWithOpc​(String query, Integer timeoutMs) throws RsInstrException
      Sends the opc-synced query to the instrument and returns the response as string list of unlimited length. Each element is trimmed for paired quotes and trailing spaces. If timeoutMs is null, -1 or 0, the current Opc Timeout is used. If the response is empty, the method returns 0-length List.
      Throws:
      RsInstrException

    • queryStringArrayWithOpc

      Throws:
      RsInstrException
